name: CreateIncidentTypeCustomField
description:
Create a custom field for a specific incident type.

This tool creates a custom field for a specified incident type on PagerDuty, allowing users to extend incidents with their own data to enhance filtering, search, and analytics. It requires `custom_fields.write` OAuth scope.

parameters.name: incident_type_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the incident type for which the custom field is created.

value_schema.description: The ID or name of the Incident Type.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API version using the `Accept` header for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: The MIME type of the body content. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: custom_field_details
parameters.description: Details of the custom field to be created, including name, display name, data type, field type, description, enabled status, default value, and field options.

name.description: The name of the custom field.

display_name.description: The display name of the Incident Type.

data_type.description: The data type of the custom field.

field_type.description: The field type of the custom field.

description.description: The description of the custom field.

enabled.description: Whether the custom field is enabled.

default_value.description: The default value of the custom field.

field_options.description: The options for the custom field. Can only be applied to fields with a `field_type` of `single_value_fixed` or `multi_value_fixed`. When creating a fixed-value custom field, this property is required, as the field must be created with at least one field option.

field.description: Details of the custom field to be created.
